qas.question: What is the primary issue with running software testing?

answers.text: testing under all combinations of inputs and preconditions (initial state) is not feasible

qas.question: What types of software bugs are difficult to find during testing?
What other non-functional dimensions can cause software to underperform and cause other problems?

plausible_answers.text: testing under all combinations of inputs and preconditions (initial state) is not feasible

qas.question: What is the secondary problem  with running software testing?
Defects that occur frequently are how easy to find?
What are examples of functional dimensions of quality?
What is the issue with the functional dimensions of quality?

context: A fundamental problem with software testing is that <a0_0><b3_0>testing under all combinations of inputs and preconditions (initial state) is not feasible<b3_0/><a0_0/>, even with a simple product.:17-18 This means that the number of defects in a software product can be very large and <a1_0>defects that occur infrequently<a1_0/> are <b4_0>difficult<b4_0/> to find in testing. More significantly, non-functional dimensions of quality (how it is supposed to be versus what it is supposed to do)—<a2_0><b5_0>usability, scalability, performance, compatibility, reliability<b5_0/><a2_0/>—<b6_0>can be highly subjective<b6_0/>; something that constitutes sufficient value to one person may be intolerable to another.
